episodes.title: Should a Christian Wear a Beard?
episodes.description: For decades, Jehovah's Witnesses have held a prohibition on men having facial hair, more specifically beards. There has been a calling from some of the branch offices of Jehovah's Witnesses for clarification on whether or not men should be allowed to have beards in the organization. On December 15, the Governing Body finally gave this clarification. Is this what you were expecting?

episodes.title: Reporting Time No More
episodes.description: I know I am a little behind the ball in getting caught up on this news. I am sure a lot of you already have heard about this new announcement but here is my take on reporting field ministry time.

episodes.title: What Does It Mean To Safeguard Your Heart?
episodes.description: I recently had a conversation with my Mom about no longer being a Jehovah's Witness. It ultimately led to the discussion of having limited contact to safeguard her heart against the possibility that I could lure her away from "the truth". Join me as I discuss how this went and what it means when Jehovah's Witnesses tell their unbelieving family members that they will need to limit their contact.

episodes.title: The Afterlife
episodes.description: Where do we go when we die? Is it to heaven? Do we fall asleep? Do we wake up in paradise? Let's look into the Jehovah's Witness's belief in life after death coupled with other Christian beliefs and discover for ourselves what really happens in the afterlife. Scriptures quoted when discussing Jehovah's Witness doctrine are from the New World Testament translation of the Bible. All other Bible text quoted is from the King James Version.

episodes.title: Jehovah's Witnesses and Death
episodes.description: My dad passed away this last week and right away I began to hear the rhetoric of the Jehovah's Witnesses starting. First I was told if I wanted to see my dad again in the resurrection that I would need to make a choice in my faith. Then close friends of the family began really pushing meeting attendance. I began thinking this isn't what it means to grieve the loss of a loved one. This week we dig into how Jehovah's Witnesses view death and the afterlife. We have transitioned over from using the New World Translation to fully using the KJV unless the scripture is directly quoted from a source of The Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society. If you have any questions, comments, or concerns about this episode please feel free to email me at apostatejw@gmail.com.

episodes.title: Signs of The Times
episodes.description: How do Jehovah's Witnesses feel about the signs of the end of the system? How should we as Christians really feel about this topic? Think about these questions as we explore the signs of the times.

episodes.title: 2022 Governing Body Update #8
episodes.description: The Governing Body recently gave an update on the current state of affairs of the Watchtower Society. Join us as we listen to and discuss this update. All scripture quoted is from the New World Translation unless otherwise indicated. If you have any questions, comments, or concerns feel free to email me at apostatejw@gmail.com. Thank you for your continued listening and support.

episodes.title: What Do Jehovah's Witnesses Really Believe? (Part 2)
episodes.description: This week we continue our discussion on what Jehovah's Witnesses believe—breaking down their beliefs on Salvation, Holy Spirit, and Shunning. Thank you to everyone who continues to listen and to new listeners. I appreciate the support I have received since starting this podcast. If you have anything you would like to share, whether it be questions, comments, concerns, or your own story, please feel free to email me at apostatejw@gmail.com.

episodes.title: What Do Jehovah's Witnesses Really Believe? (Part 1)
episodes.description: Ever wonder what the Jehovah's Witnesses really believe? Join me as we go through their history and doctrine to discover the truth behind the truth. I reference this week from jwfacts.com, the September 15, 1895 Zion's Watch Tower, What Does the Bible Really Teach?, and How To Read The Bible for All Its Worth. All scriptures cited are from the New World Translation unless otherwise noted. Please feel free to email me your questions, comments and concerns or even your story to apostatejw@gmail.com.

episodes.title: Christian Cult of Jehovah's Witnesses
episodes.description: Sorry sorry sorry. I know I am a day late and I have received a few texts asking when this will be posted. Had a hectic day yesterday and as you can see this is my longest episode to date. So I wanted to ensure I devoted as much as possible to recording instead of trying to rush in between house cleaning yesterday. For those who are still Jehovah's Witnesses or studying to become a Jehovah's Witness, this is your episode to identify the red flags of what a cult is and how that corresponds to the religion you are currently a part of. For those of us who have already left we see these as subtle reminders of why we should never look behind but forward. This week I referenced the jw.org website, a howstuffworks.com article entitled, "How Cults Work", Netflix "Explained: Cults", and various articles from Dr. Robert Jay Lifton. All bible quotes are taken from the New World Translation unless otherwise noted. If you have any comments, questions, or concerns, or would like to share your story, please feel free to email me at apostatejw@gmail.com.
